required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of the Genetic Architecture of Neutrophil-Mediated Inflammatory Skin Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Enrichment of Rare Coding Genetic Variants in Patients Affected by Neutrophil-Mediated Inflammatory Dermatoses

brief_summary.textblock:
This study investigates the genetic architecture of Neutrophil-Mediated Inflammatory Skin Diseases. After collecting informed consent, all patients' clinical phenotype is graded at inclusion with a detailed case report form and a discovery cohort formed based on the certainty of diagnosis. The DNA of patients in the discovery cohort is analyzed by whole exome sequencing which identifies all protein-coding genetic variants. Subsequently, statistical burden tests are going to identify enrichment of rare coding genetic variants in patients affected by Neutrophil-Mediated Inflammatory Skin Diseases.
The ultimate goal is to reveal the responsible gene(s) that may then be targets for clinical intervention.

detailed_description.textblock:
Timeframe:
- Collection of DNA for discovery cohort until 05/2016
- Data analysis until 12/2014 for pyoderma gangrenosum, until 12/2016 for other NMID
- Report and data presentation early 2015 for PG, 2017 for other NMID

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional

primary_outcome.measure: Enrichment of rare coding genetic variants
primary_outcome.description: Whole exome sequencing is going to detect rare coding genetic variants in cases of Neutrophil-Mediated Inflammatory Skin Diseases. Statistical burden tests are applied to test for excess of rare variants in cases versus available controls of matching ancestry.

clinical_study.condition: Other Specified Inflammatory Disorders of Skin or Subcutaneous Tissue
Erosive Pustular Dermatosis of the Scalp
Unclassified Periodic Fever Syndromes / Autoinflammatory Syndromes
Neutrophilic Dermatosis of the Dorsal Hands (Pustular Vasculitis)
Small Vessel Vasculitis Including Urticarial Vasculitis

biospec_descr.textblock: Saliva or Blood Serum Histology FFPE

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a history of Neutrophil-Mediated Inflammatory Dermatoses (NMID) of any subtype

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- History of NMID or active disease.
- Informed consent.
Exclusion criteria:
- No consent to either part of the study.

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital Zurich, Dept. of Dermatology

facility.name: University Hospital Zurich, Dept. of Dermatology
